definition[0]: only with great difficulty or effort
example[0]: She was very old and barely able to walk.
example[1]: Mary had barely enough money to live on.
example[4]: She was barely aware of his presence.
example[5]: Joe and his brother are barely on speaking terms.
definition[2]: used to emphasize that something happens immediately after a previous action
example[6]: Graham had barely finished his coffee when Henry returned.
definition[3]: used before amounts or numbers to emphasize that they are surprisingly small
example[7]: Nowadays, the village has barely 100 inhabitants.
